Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Industrial Metals (2025-09-16)

Industrial Metals

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Industrial Metals presents a bifurcated market sentiment. Speculators show strong conviction in Copper-#1 and Lithium Hydroxide, with positions nearing bullish extremes. Conversely, Cobalt remains under severe speculative bearish pressure. Commercial hedgers are broadly increasing net-short exposure, indicating a fundamental counter-view to speculative enthusiasm in some key assets.

Key Opportunities

  • Copper- #1 Continued Bullish Momentum: Speculators hold substantial and increasing net-long positions, with a Z-score nearing extreme levels (1.63), signaling strong conviction for further price upside.
  • Lithium Hydroxide Strong Bullish Conviction: Near-extreme bullish speculative positioning (Z-score 1.68) reflects robust market confidence for sustained upward price movement.

Key Risks

  • Cobalt Extreme Bearish Exposure: Managed Money's highly extreme net-short position (Z-score -12.77) indicates deep market pessimism and signals potential for continued downside pressure, or a sharp short squeeze from oversold levels.
  • Industrial Metals Broad Commercial Hedging: Across the sector, commercial hedgers are increasing net-short positions in key metals like Copper-#1 and Lithium Hydroxide, suggesting they anticipate future supply or lower prices, posing a fundamental counter-risk to speculative bullishness.

Asset Class Summaries

COPPER- #1

  • Speculators: Dominantly bullish with a significant net-long position (+42,097 contracts), increasing by +338 WoW. Positioning is near extreme bullish (Net ManagedMoney % OI: 19.05, Z-score: 1.63).
  • Commercials: Heavily net-short (-55,169 contracts), increasing net-short exposure by -3,406 WoW. They consistently hedge against rising prices.
  • Implication: Strong speculative conviction fuels potential upside, but aggressive commercial hedging warrants caution against a potential reversal.

LITHIUM HYDROXIDE

  • Speculators: Strongly bullish with a substantial net-long position (+3,731 contracts), unchanged WoW. Positioning is near extreme bullish (Net ManagedMoney % OI: 11.31, Z-score: 1.68).
  • Commercials: Heavily net-short (-10,011 contracts), increasing net-short exposure by -150 WoW.
  • Implication: Sustained speculative belief in upside is a key driver, but consistent commercial hedging suggests underlying supply expectations.

ALUMINUM MWP

  • Speculators: Shifted to net-long (+101 contracts) from net-short last week (WoW change +509). Sentiment turning bullish (Net ManagedMoney % OI: 0.40, Z-score: -1.60).
  • Commercials: Remain heavily net-short (-10,669 contracts), with minimal change WoW (-1).
  • Implication: Emerging speculative buying interest, but strong commercial hedging may cap significant upside.

STEEL-HRC

  • Speculators: Slightly net-short (-32 contracts), with a minimal WoW change (-4), indicating neutral to slightly bearish sentiment (Net ManagedMoney % OI: -0.15, Z-score: -0.15).
  • Commercials: Heavily net-short (-6,001 contracts), increasing net-short exposure by -263 WoW.
  • Implication: Stable speculative positioning, but increasing commercial hedging implies limited upside and potential for price pressure.

COBALT

  • Speculators: Dominantly bearish with a highly extreme net-short position (-1,697 contracts), increasing bearish bets by -45 WoW (Net ManagedMoney % OI: -12.77, Z-score: -12.77).
  • Commercials: Net-short (-1,301 contracts), slightly increasing net-short exposure by -57 WoW.
  • Implication: Extremely pessimistic speculative sentiment, reinforced by commercial positioning, points to persistent weakness and potentially oversold conditions.
